video:video.video:title: TCSWeekly 006 - Silverlight is fizzing along with Moonlight and Contests
video:video.video:description: My favorite episode so far - strong news-wise (Moonlight 1.0 ships, Tim Sneath reports Silverlight is fizzing, and a $5000 Silverlight game contest), hearty tutorials including how to use AddIns in&#8230;

video:video.video:title: TCSWeekly 005 - a UX Pattern Explorer and more Designer-ready content
video:video.video:description: This turned out to be a pretty design-centric episode. Quince the new UX Design Pattern Explorer launched, Illustrator to XAML plug-in is ready to be tested, Alex Knight a XAML Designer is featured&#8230;

video:video.video:title: TCSWeekly 004 - amazing visuals and one monster MVVM article
video:video.video:description:
This episode includes amazing visuals in both blu and Descry, one beefy MVVM article and the announcement that there will be no more Betas for Windows 7, next stop Release Candidate!
Stories&#8230;

video:video.video:title: TCSWeekly 003 - Silverlight, Moonlight, Kaxaml, Facebook, Multi-touch
video:video.video:description:
Stories mentioned in this episode:
Presidential Inauguration in Silverlight and Moonlight New Version of Kaxaml with Support for Silverlight 2 MVVM, WPF UI Design Pattern Silverlight Facebook&#8230;

video:video.video:title: TCSWeekly 002 - Obama, Silverlight 3, 3D Models and Virtual Earth
video:video.video:description: The biggest news from last week in the Microsoft Client World is tied to the biggest news of January, possibly of the year 2009. If you haven't already heard it echoed on twitter and blogs, last week&#8230;
